title: Reading Delimited Data
text:
Recode “Type” Variable & Filter Results

#Nested else if per instructions to OVERWRITE type of glass
glass |> mutate(
         Type_of_glass = ifelse(Type_of_glass == 1, "building_windows_float_processed",
            ifelse(Type_of_glass == 2, "building_windows_non_float_processed",
              ifelse(Type_of_glass == 3, "vehicle_windows_float_processed",
               ifelse(Type_of_glass == 4, "vehicle_windows_non_float_processed",
                ifelse(Type_of_glass == 5, "containers",
                 ifelse(Type_of_glass == 6, "tableware",
                  ifelse(Type_of_glass == 7, "headlamps","Other")))))))
                  ) |>
          filter(Fe < 0.2 & (Type_of_glass == "tableware" | Type_of_glass == "headlamps"))

title: Reading Delimited Data
section: Remove columns and add mean & median columns
text:
Remove columns and add mean & median columns

#Remove seq_name and nuc column
#add mean and median - apply single mean and median statement to multiple variables
yeast <- yeast |> 
      select(-seq_name, -nuc) |>
      mutate(
        across(c(mcg,gvh,alm,mit,erl,pox,vac), mean, .names = "mean_{.col}"),
        across(c(mcg,gvh,alm,mit,erl,pox,vac), median, .names = "median_{.col}")
             ) |>
      group_by(class)

yeast

title: Combining Excel and Delimited Data
text:
Read white-wine datasets from wd()

#relative path preferred
#main dataset
whitewine <- as_tibble(read_xlsx("C:/Users/evana/Desktop/NCSU/ST558/HW4/Homework4/white-wine.xlsx"))
whitewine

#Use variables vector object from variablelist list to rename whitewine columns
names(whitewine) <- c(variablelist$Variables)

title: Combining Excel and Delimited Data
Homework 4
text:
An example pages site with multiple pages and a table of contents.
This could be a landing page for the site. Feel free to put whatever here!

title: Conceptual Questions
text:
Conceptual Questions

If your working directory is myfolder/homework/, what relative path would you specify to get the file located at myfolder/mydata.csv?


readcsv(MyData.csv) will retrieve MyData.csv so long as anyone running this program will just need the file in their working directory.


What are the major benefits of using R projects?


R projects establish a working directory, that can be shared, and provide a way to organize the various files and documents that are used to complete work.


What is git and what is github?


Git is a version control software. It can track changes made to a document, or code, and allow authors to retrieve previous versions.


Github is an online hosting service that stores git versions in a central online location so they can be easily shared.


What are the two main differences betwen a tibble and a data.frame?


Tibbles are printed in such a way that they do not print the entire dataset - only what will fit on the screen.


Tibbles also show the column formats when they print.


Rewrite the following nested function call using BaseR’s chaining operator:


library(dplyr)

Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 4.4.3



Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union



#Original nested code indented for clarity
arrange(
  filter(
    select(
        as_tibble(iris), starts_with("Petal"), Species
          ), 
        Petal.Length < 1.55
        ), 
  Species
)

# A tibble: 37 × 3
   Petal.Length Petal.Width Species
          <dbl>       <dbl> <fct>  
 1          1.4         0.2 setosa 
 2          1.4         0.2 setosa 
 3          1.3         0.2 setosa 
 4          1.5         0.2 setosa 
 5          1.4         0.2 setosa 
 6          1.4         0.3 setosa 
 7          1.5         0.2 setosa 
 8          1.4         0.2 setosa 
 9          1.5         0.1 setosa 
10          1.5         0.2 setosa 
# ℹ 27 more rows



#New code using |> pipe
iris_tibble2 <-  as_tibble(iris |> select(starts_with("Petal"), Species) |>
                          filter(Petal.Length < 1.55) |>
                          arrange(Species)
                          )
                          

iris_tibble2
